intro: Fagara naranjillo var. paraguariensis, commonly known as the Paraguayan yellow huito, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Paraguay and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange fruits, which are covered in a waxy coating. The leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth surface and a glossy appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
